title: What percentage of French speak perfect English? - Quora

response.answer_text: What’s your threshold for perfect? If you mean how many French people speak English as a second language as well as in certain other places such as in the Nordic countries, then it’s less by a considerable margin. It is far better than it was even just 20 years ago, but you will not encounter as many people who seem practically bilingual as you would in say, Sweden. If you mean how many speak perfectly functional English, good enough to be able to hold a conversation, then quite a lot do nowadays. This is especially true in the younger population and the big cities in general. If you mean perfect as in absolutely flawless native-level English (which by the way, most English speakers would generally not even boast about themselves), then the number is obviously much lower. For that you’d have to count the French people who are truly bilingual because they grew up with English at the same time as French. There are actually more people like this than you might think, but it’s certainly not the norm. So in short, there has been a marked difference in the standard of English as a second language in France in recent years. I’m not aware of any official statistics on this so I can’t really give an actual percentage, but it certainly appears to be the case in my experience. There does not however seem to be anything close to a commensurate level of improvement in second-language proficiency in most English-speaking countries though. In places like the US, it tends to still be the norm that only people with an ethnic background or immigrants from other countries are fluent in another language other than English.
